javax.speech
Class EngineList

Object
  EngineList

public class EngineList
extends Object

Container for a set of EngineMode objects. An EngineList is used in the selection of speech Engines in conjunction with the methods of the EngineManager class. It provides convenience methods for the purpose of testing and manipulating the EngineMode objects it contains.

An EngineList object is typically obtained through the availableEngines method of the EngineManager class. The orderByMatch, anyMatch, requireMatch and rejectMatch methods are used to prune the list to find the best match given multiple criteria.

See Also:
EngineMode, EngineManager, availableEngines

Method Detail

anyMatch

public boolean anyMatch(EngineMode require)
Returns true if one or more EngineMode in the EngineList match the required features. The require object is tested with the match method of each EngineMode in the list. If any match call returns true then this method returns true.

anyMatch is often used to test whether pruning a list (with requireMatch or rejectMatch) would leave the list empty.

If require is null, then it is treated as a wildcard that matches any EngineMode. Therefore, this method always returns true if require is null, except if the EngineList is empty.

Parameters:
require - required features to match
Returns:
true if a matching engine exists
See Also:
match, requireMatch, rejectMatch

orderByMatch

public void orderByMatch(EngineMode require)
Orders this list so that elements matching the required features are at the head of the list, and others are at the end. Within categories, the original order of the list is preserved. Example: 
 // Put running engines at the head of the list.
 EngineList list = ....;
 // Running is the 3rd feature in the constructor
 EngineMode mode = new EngineMode(null, null, true, null, null);
 list.orderByMatch(mode);

The order remains unchanged if require is null.

Parameters:
require - features to match
See Also:
match

rejectMatch

public void rejectMatch(EngineMode reject)
Removes EngineMode entries from the list that match reject. The match method for each EngineMode in the list is called and if it returns true it is removed from the list. Example: 
 // Remove EngineMode objects if they support US English.
 EngineList list = ....;
 EngineMode mode = new EngineMode(new SpeechLocale("en", "US"));
 list.rejectMatch(mode);

The list becomes empty if reject is null.

Parameters:
reject - features to reject
See Also:
match

requireMatch

public void requireMatch(EngineMode require)
Removes EngineMode entries from the list that do not match require. The match method for each EngineMode in the list is called and if it returns false it is removed from the list. Example: 
   // Require EngineMode objects to support US English.
   EngineList list = ....;
   EngineMode mode = new EngineMode(new SpeechLocale("en", "US"));
   list.requireMatch(mode);

The list remains unchanged if require is null.

Parameters:
require - features to match
See Also:
match

size

public int size()
Returns the number of EngineMode objects in this list.

the number of EngineMode objects in this list.

removeElementAt

public void removeElementAt(int index)
                     throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
Removes the EngineMode at the specified index. The index must be a value greater than or equal to 0 and less than the current size of the list.

Parameters:
index - the index of the EngineMode to remove
Throws:
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is invalid.
See Also:
elementAt, size
